body.p:
It is possible to sign your PDFs so they appear certified by your company. To sign a PDF you must:
Create, if you don't already have one issued, a keystore file:openssl req -new -newkey rsa:4096 -nodes -keyout my.key -out my.csr openssl x509 -req -sha256 -days 365 -in my.csr -signkey my.key -out my.pem cat my.key my.pem > my2.pem openssl pkcs12 -export -in my2.pem -out mykeystore.pkcs12 -name myAlias
Set the keystore from the command line using the -keystore-file, this file alone is enough to sign a PDF.
If you need to add more information, like your company name, location or reason, or even set a password, you can use the following parameters:
-sign-name
-sign-location
-sign-reason
-sign-password
